page.title: 02SOHAM, Cambridgeshire
page.content: There are three{commons}in Soham providing grazing land, and the town is surrounded by open, flat farmland, mostly arable. Landmarks of note include two{windmills,}one of which is still fully operational. {St.Andrew's church}has several reminders of Soham's historical connection with the sea - before Soham Mere was drained, sea-going vessels were able to sail right into Soham. Regular events include the{Soham {Pumpkin Fair,}held each September and attracting interest from all over England, and the{Spring Carnival, which raises money for local charities. Outside Soham is the hamlet of {Barway,}a small farming community.
